alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Orange, southeastern Rutland and Windsor Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ludlow, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chester, Woodstock, Thetford Hill State Park, Ludlow Village, Pomfret, Plymouth, Thetford, Hartland, Tunbridge, Mount Holly, Sharon, Bridgewater, Baltimore, West Windsor, Hartland Four Corners, Cavendish, Perkinsville Village, Mt. Holly, Randolph and Strafford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 31. Interstate 91 between mile markers 56 and 61, and between mile markers 63 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Windsor
